intro: Ricinus leucocarpus, commonly known as the white-seeded castor, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and distinctive yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain smooth, white seeds, which are used in traditional medicine and as a source of oil. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed soils or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in some parts of the world.
